intro: Leptocarpus roycei, commonly known as the Royal's leptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as taro and calla lilies. The plant is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and striking, spatulate inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
